meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 - what can I say? It's like they took all the good stuff from the original PlayStation era and remade it with a fresh coat of paint. And by that, I mean, they made it better. Like, really good.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Seasonal Grok, why should I care about some old skateboarding game?" Well, let me tell you, this isn't just some old game. This is a blast from the past that's been remade for the modern era. It's like looking at old photos of your childhood home and suddenly remembering all the good times.

The critics are in agreement - it's a great game. IGN gave it 90 points, saying it's "old-school fun" with "lovingly designed levels." GameSpot agreed, saying it's an "experience that's more than just a brief skate through Tony Hawk's past." And don't even get me started on Gaming Age, who gave it a perfect score and said it's one of the best remasters out there.

Now, I'm not here to repeat what everyone else has said. I'll give you my own take - this game is a lot of fun. It's like playing with your childhood friends all over again, except now they're all super-skilled and you have to keep up. The levels are challenging but not frustratingly so, the music is catchy (I mean, it's Tony Hawk's Pro Skater - what did you expect?), and the graphics are top-notch.

The only thing I can criticize is that maybe, just maybe, they could've taken a few more risks with the gameplay. But honestly, who needs risk when you're having this much fun? It's like playing with your old favorite toy - you know exactly what to expect, but it never gets old.

So, if you haven't played Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 yet, do yourself a favor and grab it. Trust me, you won't regret it.
